document.docAuthor: Ng, Peter K. L. & Forges, Bertrand Richer De
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the spider crab genus Maja Lamarck, 1801 (Crustacea: Brachyura: Majoidea: Majidae), with descriptions of seven new genera and 17 new species from the Atlantic and Indo-West Pacific

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the spider crab genus Maja Lamarck, 1801 (Crustacea: Brachyura: Majoidea: Majidae), with descriptions of seven new genera and 17 new species from the Atlantic and Indo-West Pacific

heading.emphasis:
Key to species of
Alcomaja
n. gen.

paragraph.keyLead: – Dorsal surface of carapace and ambulatory legs covered with scattered short, hooked setae, sometimes dense; G1 curved... .................................................................................................2

3. Carapace relatively more elongate; pseudorostral spines long ( Figs. 17E , 36O ); G1 gently curved with distal part gently curved downwards ( Fig. 20O–Q ); Madagascar ........................ ..............................................................
Alcomaja miriky
n. sp.
– Carapace relatively broad; pseudorostral spines relatively shorter ( Figs. 17A–D , 36M, N ); G1 similar to above or otherwise ..4

– Dorsal surface of carapace as above or otherwise ( Figs. 16A–C , 18C–F ); intercalated tooth subtruncate basally ( Fig. 18C–F ): G1 gently or strongly curved..................................................6

6. Dorsal surface of carapace with distinct small and large sharp, rounded granules ( Figs. 16B, C , 18C, D ); pseudorostral spines with rounded cross-section ( Fig. 18C, D ); ischium of third maxilliped distinctly granular ( Fig. 45B, C ); G1 gently curved, distal part straight ( Fig. 19D–F ); South China Sea and Philippines ...............
Alcomaja gracilipes ( Chen & Ng, 1999 )
